author: ceo
title: Decentralized Physics Simulations
description: Physics simulations run on centralized servers due to lack of decentralized infrastructure for academic & industry collaboration & use-cases

f6_assessments.q0: The project tries to create a decentralized protocol for the simulation of physical systems while leveraging Nunet for computational resources and SingularityNet for AI enhancements. The proposer also built a tokenomics system to incentive computation, data, algorithm development, mining, and community rewards for collaborations and support from individual community members, academics, and even corporations. The proposal has proposed a solution to a problem on the challenge and would be beneficial to the larger Cardano ecosystem. The proposal also provides a potential risk of the complexity of the project but they are confident to solve them with additional time.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal outlined clearly the roadmap with milestones on each step. The budget information is clear, that is a salary of 3.5k$ for eight months, totaling 28k$, and a budget for hardware is not needed as the proposer currently has self-owned servers. The proposal gives details information of the proposer, from the background, research experience, and skills, also providing a LinkedIn profile and personal GitHub account.
f6_assessments.q2: Metrics for success are clearly defined in 9 points, however, points 5 and 6 are the same, that is Peer-reviewed article comparing to centralized solutions, and can be written once. Indicators of success are also articulated clearly in great detail.

f6_assessments.q0:
This project is very ambitious, it wants to take a chunk of the multibillion dollar computation market, bring it to the blockchain space and decentralize it in the way. This is next level thinking that Cardano is created for, better future for everyone. Literally everyone will benefit from a project like this, the regular user, the SPO, the investor, every human. Science is for everyone! Currently the team is developing a decentralized protocol for simulation of physical systems and this proposal regards the creation algorithms in that area.
The proposal was broader in F7 and missed funding for a hair. Now the proposal is renewed and changed to accommodate step by step development and funding. This is a very good thing because with a low price tag it is easier to give the proposers a chance to prove themselves and show results.
I strongly agree that in this fund there is no better place to host this proposal than the miscellaneous challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
As mentioned before this proposal has a history from fund 7. It is very well written and very detailed and presented from different standpoints. The proposal has a road map and a timeline attached to it. 
The budget is purely for salaries for 8 months of research and coding. The proposer has self owned servers on which to test. Also the voter should know, that the project is way larger than it looks by the funding demanded and the proposer explicitly states that he will seek additional funding after the 8 months of runway. The good thing for the community is that for that time the community could be certain that this team delivers.
The team is well presented and consists of young specialists with experience in the field. There are links to active LinkedIn profiles. Unfortunately the team is a bit small and this reduces the redundancy.
I agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
Auditing this proposal will be difficult because there are no milestones and it should be done by a specialist in this field. However the auditing section of the proposal is full of points that are clearly visible even from an armature. Namely a peer reviewed article, completed white paper and tokenomics by month 5 and an academic partnership.
I agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
As there is very high demand for simulating software around the globe ex.Matlab, all the engineering works and research workers need one or another simulation kit to conduct their experiment or researches.
The proposer has long vision for science ,as he wants to bring a similar simulator for users, where it will be an open source which will definitely attract all the researches ,since all the simulating software are of very high cost to get the license ,the proposer has an idea of providing incentives to those people who are contributing to such projects, by this developers all over the world will have opportunity to contribute towards this project, the proposal has great future ahead since the requirement of such simulators is increasing everyday ,hence This proposal effectively addresses the challenge
f6_assessments.q1:
Since not only proposer's team is completing the task ,all the  developers around the globe are contributing towards this model hence this model has higher rate of being successful.
Achieving any simulator is not a easy task even with a expertise team, as it needs very high precision to be build , the probability factors and mathematical calculation should be of very high accurate, molecular dynamics can be integrated with some efforts but implementing neural network would definitely be a challenging one, since researches are still going on such projects ,hence plan presented it is highly likely this proposal can be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has explained about the importance of simulators in the future, and importance of requirement of simulator in every field.
The proposal even contains excellent roadmap for the project , and its goals to be achieved for every 3 months, the proposer has also introduced himself and his experience in the field of AI.
The proposal contains excellent success indicators for measuring the success from scaling, reviewing making computational changes  for the simulator , it also contains neat budget breaking, hence the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
"To begin with, the problem leading to this proposal is clearly stated and explained in the overview part. The proposer not only states their opinions but also give specific demonstration to them. They show their goals in an explicit way as well as the importance of Cardano involvement in their project. 
One of the strong point of this proposal is the proposer's want for utilization and upgradation of the existing tools or websites like Nunet or SingularityNet in support for project establishment. Combination and integration is an important factor in creating a stronger ecosystem. Plus, the author shows their passion and experience for the project by mentioning that they are also working on a tokenomics system. The proposer is also a PhD candidate, thus, when he mention something, a reference link would be attached, which creates a stronger affirmation for the ideas. The last paragraph of this 'objectives and goals' part is an indicator for the proposer's vision, ambition with specific examples as their demonstration for ideas. The impact of this project reaches another level as the proposer even considers benefits of a larger group, industry and community. They list out a lot of examples to prove their ideas in this part. Still, if the proposer can descrbe more detailed on how this project can strongly affect or build up Cardano ecosystem, it would be more completed. 
They have an quite comprehensive explanation for the reasons that they choose to put this proposal in miscellaneous challenge. 
The foreseen risks are illustrated clear enough and they also offer their ways to handle those risks cleverly. "
f6_assessments.q1:
"The timeline of this proposal can be considered as crystal clear when the author divides the tasks into small periods of 2-3 months and particularizes the detailed tasks for each period. The three stages have particular roles and purposes that closely linked to each other. The first period is comprehensibly spent for making the prototype of traditional computational algorithms, they next one is for making prototype of AI based simulations, and the last stage is lanching and for following-up activities. They also partition the timeline into two, one for specific algorithms, and one for high level design. As a result, the feasibility of this proposal is incredibly strengthened. 
The budget breakdown for this proposal is little surprising and quite impressive as they declare to pay out-of-pocket spendings in order to prove their ability of gaining funds. This can be referred to the proposer's great confidence in the feasiblity and chance of success of their ideas. 
The proposer's profile is introduced with great details and evidences for his work. However, it could be better and more balanced if his teammate's roles and related experiences are provided with more information."
f6_assessments.q2: Some of the specific milestones are mentioned in this part; for instance, white paper and tokenomics will be completed in 5 months, building strong academic partnerships in 8 months; and also specific numbers for the targets such as gaining 4 to 5 academic collaboratings in 2 to 3 years. The metrics are explicit and measurable enough. The illustration of success is clear and united with the whole solution of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal hopes to make decentralized physics simulations possible on Cardano with collaborations with Nunet and Snet, so as the Miscellaneous challenge is quite open in respect to possibilities, this seems like a useful tool to have on Cardano. building a community that supports wide scale development in academia and industry will be super important for wide-scale adaption of Cardano. This proposal looks to make Cardano into a science hub, which would be quite cool. Ive heard about academic group like fold-it develop software for supplying computational power to fold proteins. This project sounds like a grown up version of that.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is a PhD student with experience in many different universities. He also has published various articles in peer-reviewed journals. His github is also linked in his propsal. Overall, he is quite open about his skills, near, and long term goals.
f6_assessments.q2: It seems he will write peer-reviewed articles describing the benefits of his project. This is no simple task, if the results are good enough to publish then we can expect lots of cool things from this project. He describes all of the algorithms and AI enhancements he wants to incorporate, and gives a timelinle to do so. Overall, the roadmap and audit-ability is clear.

f6_assessments.q0: The general idea of this proposal is to develop a decentralized computations service oriented to scientific communities using Nunet(https://nunet.io)  for computational resources and SingularityNet(https://singularitynet.io) for AI. This project was close to being funded in F7 and now is being resubmitted with improvements. Since this is a miscellaneous challenge, and the idea has some important features such as the computation and the AI that do not necessarily fit 100%  in other challenges,  I consider that is totally correct to be in this one. Furthermore, the target users are people from the academic or small industries/start-ups  that have no easy access to computational resources as big companies have, for that reason I consider that it provides a high value to cardano and promotes adoption. Although, this conclusion may be biased since I am the kind of user that had to train models in expensive AWS or Google Cloud instances for testsing proof of concepts or even just for learning.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer who will also be the one developing the project is a PhD candidate with education and experience in physics and bioinformatics. The project is divided in three stages with duration between 2 and three months where he will prototyping and implementing specific algorithms. Additionally, he plans to deliver a whitepaper with tokenomics and protocols, and ​​at least one publication in a peer-reviewed journal. The budget is for funding up to month eight, leaving future work for other Catalyst funds or other funding mechanisms. Even though there’s a detailed plan of deliverables, the budget only asks for a one person salary for 8 months, and states that additional resources, if any, will be obtained out of pocket. This is a concern for the success of the project since it depends on a lot of work in only one person and the budget may not be enough. For that reason I can not provide a full score on this section, and as recommendation I suggest to split the project in small scope ones, targeting a protocol one at a time and delivering results that can be measured and provide the launching base for the more advanced functionalities.
f6_assessments.q2: The project defines objective deliverables and metrics that are organized in the project timeline such as performance KPI, accuracy of the algorithms, the delivery of the whitepaper and its peer reviews. It addresses a specific problem that scientists and ai/data science engineers and technicians  face if they are not part of a big corporation. I unquestionably see that the project has a clear purpose and solution and that its milestones can be audited by the community.

solution: Free decentralized physics computations while rewarding computation & data for corporate, academic, and community involvement with Cardano
experience: Justin Diamond - PhD Candidate - AI Researcher in Physics, Chemistry, Pharma, Bioinformatics at academic institutions including University of Michigan, Toyota Technological Institute of Chicago, Boston University, University of Luxembourg, and University of Basel.
